Configure an additional delay to improve subtitle synchronisation.
Configure for how long the infobar will remain visible after activation.
Configure for how many minutes finished events should remain visible in the EPG. Useful when you need information about an event which has just finished, or has been delayed.

msgid: Configure on which devices the background delete option should be used.
Configure the DiSEqC mode for this LNB.
Configure the aspect ratio of the screen.
Configure the behavior when movie playback is manually stopped.
Configure the behavior when movie playback is started.
Configure the behavior when reaching the end of a movie, during movie playback.
Configure the border width of the subtitles. The dark border makes the subtitles easier to read on a light background.
Configure the brightness level of the front panel display during standby.
Configure the brightness level of the front panel display.
Configure the color of the external subtitles, alternative (normal in white, italic in yellow, bold in cyan, underscore in green), white or yellow.
Configure the color of the teletext subtitles.
Configure the contrast level of the front panel display.
Configure the duration in minutes for the screensaver.
Configure the first audio language (highest priority).
Configure the first subtitle language (highest priority).
Configure the font size of the subtitles.
Configure the function of a long press on the power button.
Configure the function of a short press on the power button.
Configure the function of the '0' button do when PIP is active.
Configure the general audio delay of Dolby Digital sound tracks.
Configure the general audio delay of stereo sound tracks.
Configure the hard disk drive to go to standby after the specified idle time.
Configure the horizontal alignment of the subtitles.
Configure the initial fast forward speed. When you press the fast forward button, winding will start at this speed.
Configure the initial rewind speed. When you press the rewind button, winding will start at this speed.
Configure the latitude of your location.
Configure the longitude of your location.
Configure the minimum amount of disk space to be available for recordings. When the amount of space drops below this value, deleted items will be removed from the trash can.
Configure the number of days after which items are automatically removed from the trash can.
Configure the number of days old timers are kept before they are automatically removed from the timer list.
Configure the offline decoding delay in milliseconds. The configured delay is observed at each control word parity change.
Configure the possible fast forward speeds.
Configure the refresh rate of the screen.
Configure the screen resolution in PC output mode.
Configure the sharpness of the video scaling.
Configure the skip time interval for the '1'/'3' buttons.
Configure the skip time interval for the '4'/'6' buttons.
Configure the skip time interval for the '7'/'9' buttons.
Configure the speed of the background deletion process. Lower speed will consume less hard disk drive performance.
Configure the subtitle delay when timing information is not available.
Configure the transparency of the OSD.
Configure the transparency of the black background of graphical DVB subtitles.
Configure the type of status indication icons shown in the movielist.
Configure the vertical position of the subtitles, measured from the bottom of the screen.
Configure the video output mode (or resolution).
Configure the way in which the receiver changes channels.
Configure where completed timers show up in the timer list.
Configure whether (and for how long) a second infobar will be shown when OK is pressed twice. The second infobar contains additional information about the current channel.
Configure whether multi channel sound tracks should be downmixed to stereo.
Configure whether or not an icon should be shown when your motorized dish is moving.
Configure whether or not an rotor position will be displayed on infobar
Configure which access level to use for the configuration menu. Expert level gives access to all items.
Configure which color format should be used on the SCART output.
Configure which tuner will be preferred, when more than one tuner is available. If set to 'auto' the system will give priority to the tuner having the lowest number of channels/satellites.
Configure which tuner type will be preferred, when the same service is available on different types of tuners. Choose 'no priority' to try each alternative one by one independent from tuner type.
Configure your network settings, and press OK to start the scan
Configures which video output connector will be used.

msgid:
If your TV has a brightness or contrast enhancement, disable it. If there is something called "dynamic", set it to standard. Adjust the backlight level to a value suiting your taste. Turn down contrast on your TV as much as possible.
Then turn the brightness setting as low as possible, but make sure that the two lowermost shades of gray stay distinguishable.
Do not care about the bright shades now. They will be set up in the next step.
If you are happy with the result, press OK.
openhdf: 如果您的電視機有亮度或對比度增強項，請關閉它。如果裏面有標為“動態”的專案，將其設定為標準。調整背光等級的值以符合您的口味。將電視機的對比度盡可能地降低。然後盡可能將亮度設定調低，但請確保最下面的兩個灰色能夠分辨出來。現在，不必關心亮度的色調，它們將在接下來的步驟中設定。如果您對結果感到滿意，按OK 。

msgid: This DVD RW medium is already formatted - reformatting will erase all content on the disc.

msgid:
This plugin creates a USB stick which can be used to update the firmware of your receiver without the need for a network or WLAN connection.
First, a USB stick needs to be prepared so that it becomes bootable.
In the next step, an NFI image file can be downloaded from the update server and saved on the USB stick.
If you already have a prepared bootable USB stick, please insert it now. Otherwise plug in a USB stick with a minimum size of 64 MB!

This test checks for configured nameservers.
If you get a "unconfirmed" message:
- please check your DHCP, cabling and adapter setup
- if you configured your nameservers manually please verify your entries in the "Nameserver" configuration

This test checks whether a network cable is connected to your LAN adapter.
If you get a "disconnected" message:
- verify that a network cable is attached
- verify that the cable is not broken

This test checks whether a valid IP address is found for your LAN adapter.
If you get a "unconfirmed" message:
- no valid IP address was found
- please check your DHCP, cabling and adapter setup

This test checks whether your LAN adapter is set up for automatic IP address configuration with DHCP.
If you get a "disabled" message:
 - then your LAN adapter is configured for manual IP setup
- verify thay you have entered correct IP informations in the adapter setup dialog.
If you get an "enabeld" message:
-verify that you have a configured and working DHCP server in your network.
This test detects your configured LAN adapter.
This will (re-)calculate all positions of your rotor and may remove previously memorised positions and fine-tuning!\nAre you sure?
Timer overlap in timers.xml detected!\nPlease recheck it!
openhdf: 測驗timers.xml有重疊部分！\n請重新檢視它!

msgid:
To update your receiver firmware, please follow these steps:
1) Turn off your box with the rear power switch and make sure the bootable USB stick is plugged in.
2) Turn mains back on and hold the DOWN button on the front panel pressed for 10 seconds.
3) Wait for bootup and follow instructions of the wizard.
Toggle a cut mark at the current position
Try to find used transponders in cable network.. please wait...

msgid: Warning: no LNB; using factory defaults.

Welcome to the cutlist editor.

Seek to the start of the stuff you want to cut away. Press OK, select 'start cut'.

Then seek to the end, press OK, select 'end cut'. That's it.

Welcome to the image upgrade wizard. The wizard will assist you in upgrading the firmware of your receiver by providing a backup facility for your current settings and a short explanation of how to upgrade your firmware.

Welcome.

If you want to connect your receiver to the Internet, this wizard will guide you through the basic network setup of your receiver.

Press OK to start configuring your network

Welcome.

This start wizard will guide you through the basic setup of your receiver.
Press the OK button on your remote control to move to the next step.
What do you want to scan?
When enabled the PiP can be closed by the exit button.
When enabled, AIT data will be included in http streams. This allows a client receiver to use HbbTV.
When enabled, ECM data will be included in http streams. This allows a client receiver to do the descrambling.
When enabled, EIT data will be included in http streams. This allows a client receiver to show EPG.
When enabled, a popup message will be shown when a movie has finished and the next one will start.
When enabled, a popup message will be shown when a recording starts.
When enabled, a radio background image will be visible while listening to a radio channel.
When enabled, a recording is allowed to interrupt live tv, when there are no free tuners.
When enabled, a warning will be displayed and the user will get an option to stop or to continue the timeshift.
When enabled, channel numbering will start at '1' for each bouquet.
When enabled, content with an aspect ratio of 4:3 will be stretched to fit the screen.
When enabled, continue to the next bouquet when the last channel of the current bouquet is reached while changing channels.
When enabled, deleted recordings are moved to the trash can, instead of being deleted immediately.
When enabled, display the EIT now/next eventdata in infobar. When disabled, display now/next eventdata from the EPG cache instead.
When enabled, encryption info will be shown in the infobar (when supported by the skin).
When enabled, error messages related to the Common Interface module will not be shown.
When enabled, error messages related to zapping will not be shown.
When enabled, external subtitles will be always turned on for playback movie.
When enabled, graphical DVB subtitles are preferred over teletext subtitles, when both types are available.
When enabled, graphical DVB subtitles will be centered horizontally.
When enabled, graphical DVB subtitles will be displayed at their original position.
When enabled, graphical DVB subtitles will be displayed in yellow, instead of the original color.
When enabled, http streams are descrambled on the server side. The (remote) client receiver does not have to do descrambling. Default on.

When enabled, always descramble receiving http streams. This takes up more resources (descrambling demuxers), only enable if necessary. Individual streams are always descrambled if 0x100 is added to the service type, regardless of this setting. Default off.
When enabled, authentication is required to watch http streams.
When enabled, it is possible to leave the movieplayer with exit.
When enabled, measure power consumption to detect when the rotor stops turning (when supported by the tuner).
When enabled, number markers will be hiden.
When enabled, services may be grouped in multiple bouquets.
When enabled, show channel numbers in the channel selection screen.
When enabled, subtitles for the hearing impaired can be used.
When enabled, subtitles for the hearing impaired will be preferred over normal subtitles, when both types are available.
When enabled, teletext pages will be cached, allowing faster access.
When enabled, teletext subtitles will be displayed at their original position.
When enabled, the channel selection list will be hidden while listening to a radio channel
When enabled, the infobar will be displayed when a new event starts.
When enabled, the infobar will be displayed when changing channels.
When enabled, the infobar will be displayed when skipping forwards/backwards during media playback.
When enabled, the length of each recording will be shown in the movielist (this might cause some additional loading time).
When enabled, the receiver will automatically use the audio track which you selected before.
When enabled, the receiver will automatically use the subtitles which you selected before.
When enabled, the receiver will no longer monitor the tuned transponder for possible changes. Do not use this option unless you know what you are doing.
When enabled, the receiver will select an AC3 track (when available).
When enabled, the receiver will select an AC3+ track (when available).
When enabled, timeshift starts automatically in background after specified time.
When enabled, use DHCP for the IP configuration.
When nonzero, a recording will start earlier than the starting time indicated by the EPG.
When nonzero, a recording will stop later than the ending time indicated by the EPG.
When the content has an aspect ratio of 16:9, choose whether to scale/stretch the picture.
When the content has an aspect ratio of 4:3, choose whether to scale/stretch the picture.

When you do a factory reset, you will lose ALL your configuration data
(including bouquets, services, satellite data ...)
After completion of factory reset, your receiver will restart automatically!

Really do a factory reset?
openhdf:
如果恢復出廠設定，全部個人設定將丟失
(包括衛星, 頻道, 自定義組等 ...)
完成出廠設定復位後, 接收機將自動重啟!

確定要恢復出廠設定嗎?

msgid: and never show this message again
Configure if and how crypto icons will be shown in the channel selection list.
Configure if and how the record indicator will be shown in the channel selection list.
Configure if and how wide columns will be shown in the channel selection list.
Configure if service picons will be shown in the channel selection list.

Configure the cursor behaviour in the channel selection list. When opening the channel selection list you can keep on the current service or already select up/down and you are able to revert the B+/B- buttons.
When enabled the arrow buttons around the OK button will follow the 'neutrino' style zap controls instead of the enigma2 style.
When enabled the left, right, CH+/-, B+/-, P+/- buttons will follow the 'neutrino' style zap controls instead of the enigma2 style.
Enable zapping with CH+/-, B+/-, P+/-
When enabled you can zap channels with the  CH+/-, B+/-, P+/- buttons instead of opening the channel selection list.
When enabled you get the channel selection list via the OK button, the infobar toggle is then transfered to exit button
Enable volume control with arrow buttons
When enabled you can control the volume with the arrow buttons instead of getting the channel selection list
Enable OK as preview in channel selection

When enabled then when you select a new channel in the channel selection the channel selection will not close. It will only close when you select the current playing service. This is a kind of preview mode
Configure if and how long the latest service in the PiP will be remembered.
Configure what to do after activated PiP.
Show VCR scart on main menu
When enabled, the VCR scart option will be shown on the main menu
Start, stop, restart SoftCams, change settings.

Enable remote enigma2 receiver to be tried to tune into services that cannot be tuned into locally (e.g. tuner is occupied or service type is unavailable on the local tuner. Specify complete URL including http:// and port number (normally ...:8001), e.g. http://second_box:8001.
Startup the set top box in standby

When enabled enigma2 will load unlinked userbouquets. This means that userbouquets that are available, but not included in the bouquets.tv or bouquets.radio files, will still be loaded. This allows you for example to keep your own user bouquet while installed settings are upgraded
configure in which resolution pictures are displayed with the picture viewer and movieplayer

Always include ECM messages in recordings. This overrides the individual timer settings globally. It allows recordings to be always decrypted afterwards (sometimes called offline decoding), if supported by your receiver. Default: off.

Never decrypt the content while recording. This overrides the individual timer settings globally. If enabled, recordings are stored in crypted presentation and must be decrypted afterwards (sometimes called offline decoding). Default: off.
When enabled, reformat subtitles to match the width of the screen.
Configure if behind the subtitles a background is shown.
Configure if the subtitle should switch between normal, italic, bold and bolditalic
Replace `- ` in dialogs with colored text per speaker (like teletext subtitles for the hearing impaired)
Configure the source of the frontend data as shown on the infobars. 'Settings' is as stored on the settings. 'Tuner' is as reported by the tuner.

The OpenPLi team would like to point out that upgrading to the latest nightly build comes not only with the latest features, but also with some risks. After the update, it is possible that your device no longer works as expected. We recommend you create backups with Autobackup or Backupsuite. This allows you to quickly and easily restore your device to its previous state, should you experience any problems. If you encounter a 'bug', please report the issue on www.openpli.org.\n\nDo you understand this?
